newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price - USDA.

text.p: USDA reported Thursday that around 3,000 head were exported into the United States at two crossing points Wednesday.
Through Santa Teresa, New Mexico, around 1,500 steer calves were sold, although not enough to establish market trend prices.
"Around 80 percent of supply were sold previously on video or retained by owners. Bulk of supply consisted of steers weighing 300-500 lb," USDA said.
Through Presidio, Texas, around 1,500 steer head were sold at steady prices compared to last week. "Trade moderate, demand good," USDA said.
Prices for head weighing 300-400 lb were 94-104 cents/lb and for 400-500 lb head at 84-94 cents/lb.
((--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom +525 7289530)) E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com
